column1: Table 3. Admissions, releases, and yearend sentenced population in California state prisons, December 31, 2000–2011
Data source(s): National Prisoner Statistics Program
Author(s): E. Ann Carson and William J. Sabol
Table 3. Admissions, releases, and yearend sentenced population in California state prisons, December 31, 2000–2011
Note: Counts are based on prisoners with a sentence of more than 1 year.
a/Excludes transfers, escapes, and those absent without leave (AWOL). Includes other conditional release violators, returns from appeal or bond, and other admissions.
b/Includes all conditional release violators returned to prison for violations of conditions of release or for new crimes.
c/Excludes transfers, escapes, and those absent without leave (AWOL). Includes other conditional release violators, returns from appeal or bond, and other admissions.
d/Includes releases to probation, supervised mandatory releases, and other unspecified conditional releases.
e/Includes expirations of sentence, communtations, and other unconditional releases.
Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, National Prisoner Statistics Program, 2000–2011.
